intro: Watsonia praecox, commonly known as the early Watsonia, is a striking perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking clusters of tubular, often brightly colored flowers, typically in shades of red, orange, or yellow. Watsonia praecox thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its flowering period occurs in early spring, adding a vibrant splash of color to gardens during the cooler months.
